content.text:
# List of Ron DeSantis 2024 presidential campaign endorsements

This is a list of notable individuals and organizations which have endorsed Ron DeSantis to be the Republican Party's nominee in the 2024 U.S. presidential election. DeSantis withdrew his candidacy in January 2024.
Federal executive officials
]]
]]
Former
* John Anderson, U.S. Attorney for the District of New Mexico (2018–2021)
* Jim Bridenstine, Administrator of NASA (2018–2021); U.S. Representative from OK-01 (2013–2018)
* Charles Cooper, U.S. Assistant Attorney General for the Office of Legal Counsel (1985–1988)
* Ken Cuccinelli, Acting U.S. Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security (2019–2021); Acting Director of U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (2019–2021); Attorney General of Virginia (2010–2014); Virginia State Senator from District 37 (2002–2010); Republican nominee for Governor of Virginia in 2013
* Emil Henry, U.S. Assistant Secretary of the Treasury for Financial Institutions (2005–2007)
* Mike Hurst, U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Mississippi (2017–2021); Republican nominee for Attorney General of Mississippi in 2015
* Scott Jennings, Deputy White House Director of Political Affairs (2005–2007); Special Assistant to the U.S. President (2005–2007)
* Larry Keefe, U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of Florida (2019–2021); Florida Public Safety Czar (2021–present)
* Ryan Newman, Counselor to the U.S. Attorney General (2017); General Counsel to the Governor of Florida (2021–present)
* Jesse Panuccio, Acting U.S. Associate Attorney General (2017 and 2018–2019); Executive Director of the Florida Department of Economic Opportunity (2013–2016); General Counsel to the Governor of Florida (2012–2013)
* Ed Rollins, White House Director of Political and Intergovernmental Affairs (1985); White House Director of Political Affairs (1982–1983)
* John Rood, U.S. Ambassador to the Bahamas (2004–2007)
* Trent Shores, U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of Oklahoma (2017–2021); Associate Justice of the Kaw Nation Supreme Court (2021–present)
* Cliff Sobel, U.S. Ambassador to Brazil (2006–2009); U.S. Ambassador to the Netherlands (2001–2005)
* Don Tapia, U.S. Ambassador to Jamaica (2019–2021)
* Jay Town, U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of Alabama (2017–2020)
* Nick Trutanich, U.S. Attorney for the District of Nevada (2019–2021); First Assistant Attorney General of Nevada (2015–2019)
U.S. Senators
]]
Former
* George LeMieux, U.S. Senator from Florida (2009–2011); Chief of Staff to the Governor of Florida (2007–2008)
U.S. Representatives
]]
]]
]]
Current
* Bob Good, U.S. Representative from VA-05 (2021–2025); Campbell County Supervisor from the Sunburst District (2016–2019) (switched endorsement to Trump after DeSantis withdrew)
* Laurel Lee, U.S. Representative from FL-15 (2023–present); Secretary of State of Florida (2019–2022) (switched endorsement to Trump after DeSantis withdrew)
* Thomas Massie, U.S. Representative from KY-04 (2012–present); Lewis County Judge-Executive (2011–2012)
* Rich McCormick, U.S. Representative from GA-06 (2023–present) (switched endorsement to Trump after DeSantis withdrew)
* Chip Roy, U.S. Representative from TX-21 (2019–present)
* Tom McClintock, U.S. Representative from CA-04 (2009–2023), CA-05 (2023–present) (switched endorsement to Trump after DeSantis withdrew)
Former
* Greg Ganske, U.S. Representative from IA-04 (1995–2003); Republican nominee for U.S. Senator from Iowa in 2002
* Frank Riggs, U.S. Representative from CA-01 (1991–1993 and 1995–1999); Member of the Windsor Unified School District Board of Trustees (1984–1988); Republican nominee for Arizona Superintendent of Public Instruction in 2018 and Republican candidate for Governor of Arizona in 2014 and U.S. Senator from California in 1998 (deceased)
* Lamar Smith, U.S. Representative from TX-21 (1987–2019); Bexar County Commissioner from Precinct 3 (1983–1985); Texas State Representative from District 57 (1981–1982)
Governors
]]
]]
Current
* Kim Reynolds, Governor of Iowa (2017–present); Chairwoman of the Republican Governors Association (2022–present); Lieutenant Governor of Iowa (2011–2017); Iowa State Senator from District 48 (2009–2011); Treasurer of Clarke County (1995–2009)(switched endorsement to Trump after DeSantis withdrew)
* Kevin Stitt, Governor of Oklahoma (2019–present) (switched endorsement to Trump after DeSantis withdrew)
Former
*Frank Keating, Governor of Oklahoma (1995–2003)
State executive officials
]]
]]
]]
Current

* Manny Díaz Jr., Education Commissioner of Florida (2022–present); Florida State Senator from District 36 (2018–2022); Florida State Representative from District 103 (2012–2018)
* John Dougall, State Auditor of Utah (2013–present); Utah State Representative from District 27 (2003–2013); Republican candidate for Lieutenant Governor of Utah in 2020
* Joseph Ladapo, Surgeon General of Florida (2021–present)
* Ashley Moody, Attorney General of Florida (2019–2025); Judge of the Thirteenth Judicial Circuit Court of Florida (2007–2017)
* Jeanette Nuñez, Lieutenant Governor of Florida (2019–2025)
* Andrew Sorrell, State Auditor of Alabama (2023–present); Alabama State Representative from District 3 (2018–2022) (switched endorsement to Trump after DeSantis withdrew)
* Andy Matthews, Controller of Nevada (2023–present)
Former
* Stephanie Kopelousos, Secretary of Transportation of Florida (2007–2011); Manager of Clay County (2011–2018)
* Adam Laxalt, Attorney General of Nevada (2015–2019); Republican nominee for U.S. Senator from Nevada in 2022 and Governor of Nevada in 2018 (previously endorsed Donald Trump)

* Cate Zeuske, Secretary of the Wisconsin Department of Revenue (1996–2001); State Treasurer of Wisconsin (1991–1995); Deputy Secretary of the Wisconsin Department of Administration (2015–2018); Wisconsin State Assemblywoman from District 4 (1985–1991) and District 54 (1983–1985)
